quote: I just wanted to say, though, on healthcare, we have the votes for healthcare. We have one senator that's in the hospital. He can't vote because he’s in the hospital. He can't vote because he’s in the hospital. We have two other votes that are coming, and we will have them. But the problem is we can't have them by Friday -- because the reconciliation ends on Friday.
quotePlain: I just wanted to say, though, on healthcare, we have the votes for healthcare. We have one senator that’s in the hospital. He can’t vote because he’s in the hospital. He can’t vote because he’s in the hospital. We have two other votes that are coming, and we will have them. But the problem is we can’t have them by Friday – because the reconciliation ends on Friday.
name: Donald Trump

checks.quote: But there's no evidence Trump has these votes, with or without Republican Sen. Thad Cochran, who is home recovering from an illness in Mississippi.
checks.quotePlain: But there’s no evidence Trump has these votes, with or without Republican Sen. Thad Cochran, who is home recovering from an illness in Mississippi.

checks.quote: ... although he's recuperating from a urological issue in Mississippi, he's not currently in a hospital... Cochran's office, however, said provisions would have been made for the senator to return to Washington to help pass the bill if his vote was needed.
checks.quotePlain: … although he’s recuperating from a urological issue in Mississippi, he’s not currently in a hospital… Cochran’s office, however, said provisions would have been made for the senator to return to Washington to help pass the bill if his vote was needed.

checks.quote: At most, Senate Republicans have 49 "yes" votes -- that's short of the majority they need to pass the latest health care overhaul. This shortfall would not be overcome even with a "yes" vote from Cochran, who is not hospitalized, but rather recuperating at home after receiving medical treatment.
checks.quotePlain: At most, Senate Republicans have 49 “yes” votes – that’s short of the majority they need to pass the latest health care overhaul. This shortfall would not be overcome even with a “yes” vote from Cochran, who is not hospitalized, but rather recuperating at home after receiving medical treatment.

claims.title: Republicans had enough votes to pass Graham-Cassidy
claims.negative: Republicans did not have enough votes to pass Graham-Cassidy
claims.negativePlain: Republicans did not have enough votes to pass Graham-Cassidy

claims.title: Thad Cochran couldn't vote on a healthcare bill since he was in the hospital
claims.negative: Thad Cochran wasn't in the hospital and could have voted on a healthcare bill
claims.negativePlain: Thad Cochran wasn’t in the hospital and could have voted on a healthcare bill
claims.truth: He was recovering at home, not in a hospital, and would have made arrangements to vote.
claims.truthPlain: He was recovering at home, not in a hospital, and would have made arrangements to vote.
